dcsControllerServer.CANopenForDCSController module¶

class dcsControllerServer.CANopenForDCSController.CANopenDCSController(channel=None, bitrate=-4, nodeId=None, loglevel=None, logformat='%(asctime)s %(levelname)-8s %(message)s')[source]¶

Bases: object

allowedNodeIds¶

Currently set node ids for message reception

bitRate¶

Currently used bit rate

channel¶

Currently used CAN channel

closeConnection()[source]¶

Convenience function for closing a connection.

dumpMessage(cobid, msg, dlc, flag, time)[source]¶

Print a CAN message to the screen

Parameters:
  • cobid (int) – CAN identifier
  • msg (bytes) – CAN data - max length 8
  • dlc (int) – Data Length Code
  • flag (int) – Flags, a combination of the canMSG_xxx and canMSGERR_xxx values
  • time (float) – Timestamp from hardware
evaluate_message(cobid, msg, dlc, flag, time)[source]¶

Evaluate a CANopen message for this node

This methods decides what to do with a recieved CAN message. Depending on the message content a subroutine may be called for processing the message.

Parameters:
  • cobid (int) – CAN identifier
  • msg (bytes) – CAN data - max length 8
  • dlc (int) – Data Length Code
  • flag (int) – Flags, a combination of the canMSG_xxx and canMSGERR_xxx values
  • time (float) – Timestamp from hardware
gather_value(index, subindex)[source]¶

Simulate collecting a value from hardware or from OD

Values are created randomly according to their data type and (in case of PSPP registers) allowed values.

Parameters:
  • index (int) – Index of the OD entry
  • subindex (int) – Subindex of the OD entry. Should be zero for single value entries
Raises:

ChipNotConnectedError – When a PSPP is not connected
mainloop()[source]¶

Read incoming messages from the Bus and pass them to the evalation function. Only aborts when a CAN error occurs.

nodeId¶

Currently used simulated node id

openConnection()[source]¶

Convenience function for going on the bus.

parse_val(val)[source]¶

Convert a value to a byte array

The byte array will be at least four bytes long. When there is not enough data, bytes conatining zero will be added. Currently only strings and integers can be parsed.

Parameters:val – The value which shall be converted
Returns:
  1. The byte array containing the data
  2. The actual data size
Return type:A tuple containing
process_sdo_read(msg, timeout=50)[source]¶

Process an SDO read request

Currently expedited and segmented transfer is supported. Error checks are done for existence of (sub)index

Parameters:msg (list) – CAN data. Must have a length of 8 bytes.
process_sdo_write(msg)[source]¶

Process a SDO write request.

Abort transfer if not expedited.

Parameters:msg (list) – CAN data. Must have a length of 8 bytes.
process_sync()[source]¶

React to a SYNC message

Simulate read out of PSPPs and send data as several PDOs.

sdo_abort_message(index, subindex, abort_code)[source]¶

Calculate message bytes for SDO error message

The first byte (0x80) indicates a SDO abort message.

Parameters:
  • index – The main index as byte-like object of length two with byteorder ‘little’
  • subindex (int) – The subindex of an specified OD object
  • abort_code – May be the actual 32 bit abort code as integer or as type sdoAbortCode
Returns:

The message bytes as a list of integers
Return type:

list
